assemblyInfo.assemblyMethod: FALCON v. 5.1.1; FALCON-Unzip v. 1.0.2; purge_haplotigs v. bitbucket 7.10.2018; scaff10x v. 2.1; Bionano 2 enzyme v. 3.2.1; Salsa2 v. 2.2; longranger align v. 2.2.2; freebayes v. 1.2.0; gEVAL manual curation v. 2019-06-18; VGP standard assembly pipeline v. 1.5

bioprojects.title: Alca torda (Razorbill) genome assembly, alternate haplotype, bAlcTor1

description.comment: The raw data and assembly of this submission are currently under a G10K-VGP publication embargo until removed from this description, following the G10K data use policy at the following URL: https://genome10k.soe.ucsc.edu/about/data_use_policy. The Razorbill is a colonical seabird and it is the closest living relative of the extinct great auk (Pinguinis impennis). The sample was provided by Copenhagen Zoological Museum and this reference assembly of has been produced as part of the G10K-VGP Project.
description.title: Animal sample from Alca torda (Razorbill)

sampleIds.label: Sample name
sampleIds.value: bAlcTor1 Razorbill tissue for G10K-VGP reference genome

assemblyInfo.comments: This assembly represents the alternate pseudohaplotype of the diploid genome Alca torda. The principal pseudohaplotype sequences are in WGS project VMED00000000.
assemblyInfo.sequencingTech: PacBio Sequel; Illumina NovaSeq; 10X Genome; Arima Hi-C
